verses.roman:
te sunirviṇṇa-manasaḥ
parimlāna-mukha-śriyaḥ
āsan sva-pauruṣe naṣṭe
daivenātibalīyasā

synonyms: te—all of them (the demigods and demons); sunirviṇṇa-manasaḥ—their minds being very disappointed; parimlāna—dried up; mukha-śriyaḥ—the beauty of their faces; āsan—became; sva-pauruṣe—with their own prowess; naṣṭe—being lost; daivena—by a providential arrangement; ati-balīyasā—which is always stronger than anything else.
translation: Because the mountain had been sunk by the strength of providence, the demigods and demons were disappointed, and their faces seemed to shrivel.
